author: lgo
msg: Followup to r20053: also test LF, CRLF and native eol styles.
* subversion/tests/cmdline/blame_tests.py
(blame_eol_styles): Added extra testcases for LF, CRLF and native line
endings. When test fails log the actual output too.

author: lgo
msg: Followup to r20086: fix this test code to make it run correctly on Windows.
Review by: rooneg
* subversion/tests/cmdline/svntest/actions.py
(run_and_validate_lock): because the comment of the lock contains a path,
we have to escape it before we can use it in a regular expression.

author: nori
msg: * STATUS (r19963): Vote +0.

author: rooneg
msg: Make the libsvn_fs_fs handling of buffer sizes consistent.  Previous to
this change some parts of the code used one size buffer for reading the
contents of revision files, but others used a much smaller size buffer.
This change centers around the idea that we want to allow path lengths
up to 4096 bytes, so buffers are sized such that they can hold a 4096
byte path, plus whatever goes on the same line as a path.
This is part of work on issue 2508.  It doesn't "fix" things, as you
can still hit the max size of the buffer with sufficient determination,
but it does make the limit larger than the maximum path length on most
platforms, so you really have to go out of your way to hit it.
* subversion/libsvn_fs_fs/fs_fs.c
(FSFS_MAX_PATH_LEN, MAX_HEADERS_STR_LEN):  New constants.
(read_header_block, read_change): Use MAX_HEADER_STR_LEN to size our
input buffer.

author: dlr
msg: * STATUS: Vote for r20078, approving.
